pullRequest.body:
Add coercion for subgroup class and submonoid class

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [3b4c0cab35](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22230/commits/3b4c0cab35536467afcb11174079dd6bb8cdc7c4)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instance : CanLift (Set G) (Subgroup G) (↑)`
`+ instance : CanLift (Set M) (Submonoid M) (↑)`
`++ ofClass`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Are you sure you need these instances?

The design intention of `SubgroupClass` is that we can save duplication since one lemma about `SubgroupClass` can be used for all types carrying this instance (e.g., we since both `Subgroup` and `ClosedSubgroup` carry this instance, any lemma written about `SubgroupClass` applies to both types).

The instances here are therefore a bit surprising because they go in the other direction: providing support for regarding such a type as a `Subgroup`. This might be a good idea but it's an extension of how I usually see these classes used so it would help review to understand the motivation.

Separately, we have three standard priorities for instances `low` (100), `default` (1000), and `high` (10000). Again there are times when we might diverge but it would be good to have evidence for why none of these has been chosen.

First question : I use `AddSubgroupClass` is also because I don't want duplicated thing, however I indeed need to take quotient between them as `AddSubgroup`, this works well because other structure also use the same quotient relation.

Second question : I am very sure it need "50" as there is anothor instance that should be triggered before this with priority "75", I think this part @xyzw12345 knows more clearly as he need it too. (It's somewhere lower in the modified file, we fould that if we made it higher, than these two instances will have a conflict and the file won't compile.)

@Thmoas-Guan and @ocfnash : This was discussed [on Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/channel/287929-mathlib4/topic/transitioning.20between.20various.20subobjects) ~9 months ago. The conclusion was that it would be nice to have

1. standalone `def`s (not coercions) named as `Submonoid.ofClass`.
2. `CanLift` instances which use these.

I meant to do it but never got around to it.
Then I can try to do it here, actually I only need the stand alone def, enough for my further use, thanks.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13685762457/job/38268702824)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13685762457/job/38268703115)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Algebra/Group): add coercion for subgroup class and submonoid class

source.title: feat(Algebra): Define the associated graded ring to filtered ring.
